entities.description: A detailed research instrument used for collecting data on drug use and health in the United States.
The usage of substances such as tobacco, alcohol, or drugs beyond the prescribed or generally accepted standards resulting in negative social, physical or self-harm impacts.
The psychological state of someone who is functioning at a satisfactory level of emotional and behavioral adjustment.
The ability of rural communities to withstand and recover from substance abuse and mental health challenges.
The level of income, employment, and financial stability of an individual or group.
The level of schooling or training achieved by an individual.
The basic physical and organizational structures and facilities needed for the operation of a society or community.
The system of rules that are created and enforced through social or governmental institutions to regulate behavior.
The medical care given to a patient for an illness or injury.

relationships.description: The survey collects data on various aspects of substance abuse.
The survey collects data on various aspects of mental health.
The survey provides insights into the capability of rural areas to handle substance abuse and mental health challenges.
Economic status can have an impact on substance abuse patterns.
Substance abuse can affect an individual's mental health.
Rural resilience is supported by the presence of robust infrastructure.
Laws regulate behaviors related to substance abuse.
Treatment provides care for individuals with mental health issues.
The survey measures the education level of participants.
